attributes.comment:
I am very disappointed with the proposed increase in the immigration benefit
application/petition and biometric fee schedule. My family is in the process of an
international adoption and have been through the I600 and fingerprint process once
already and will be needing to update shortly because our fingerprints
just "expired" at the end of March and we have another 6-10 months to wait for our
adoption to be finalized.

With the current wait times for international adoption, and talk of them only
lengthening, it is very difficult for a family to pay these fees once, let alone two
times during the adoption process.

The increased fingerprint fees are only justified if the additional cost is dedicated to
developing a means for the prints to remain on file and not "expire", then a family
will only have to pay for that fee once. There has also been a bill proposed to
lengthen the timeframe beyond 18 months for an approved I600 since the wait
times currently expire prior to an international adoption being complete. Until that
bill gets consideration I can not support the fee increase.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Suzanne
